snippet: Two leaders of Moscow’s street protest movement and the husband of another were convicted, raising fears that something resembling a campaign of reprisals had begun.
abstract: Two leaders of Moscow's street protest movement, Aleksei Navalny and Sergei Udaltsov, and Aleksei Kozlov, the husband of rally organizer Olga Romanova, are convicted in three separate judicial hearings, increasing fears that a campaign of reprisals against protest organizers in Russia has begun. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: Two leaders of Moscow’s street protest movement and the husband of another were convicted, raising fears that something resembling a campaign of reprisals had begun.

headline.main: Arrests Connected to Protests Are Made in Moscow
